messages.content: You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. Categorize each event Using the following categories: Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Sleep, Oxygen Level, Breathing Rate, Temperature, Glucose, Weight, Entertainment, Exercise, Food/Drink, Medication, Therapy, Toileting, Other. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.
Mira ate 500 grams of protein.
Food/Drink | n/a | Mira ate 500 grams of protein.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.
Mira ate banana milk and 15 mg of tylenol.

Food/Drink | n/a | Mira ate banana milk.
Medication | n/a | Mira took 15 mg of Tylenol.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. Categorize each event Using the following categories: Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Sleep, Oxygen Level, Breathing Rate, Temperature, Glucose, Weight, Entertainment, Exercise, Food/Drink, Medication, Therapy, Toileting, Other. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

February 29th, early morning notes. Mira had a good night. She slept at 9.30 and woke up a little early at 5.15 in the morning. She was quite happy, stayed in bed. And at 6.30, we turned on the television so she could watch TV. We gave her two ounces of water via G-tube at 6.45 in the morning. At 7.15, we changed her diaper and then we brought her downstairs for breakfast.

Sleep | n/a | Mira had a good night.
Sleep | 9:30 pm | She slept at 9:30 and woke up a little early at 5:15 in the morning.
Entertainment | 6:30 am | We turned on the television so she could watch TV.
Food/Drink | 6:45 am | We gave her two ounces of water via G-tube.
Toileting | 7:15 am | We changed her diaper.
Food/Drink | n/a | We brought her downstairs for breakfast.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. Categorize each event Using the following categories: Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Sleep, Oxygen Level, Breathing Rate, Temperature, Glucose, Weight, Entertainment, Exercise, Food/Drink, Medication, Therapy, Toileting, Other. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

Saturday morning, March 2nd, Mira overall had a good night's sleep, but she did wake up a couple of times, and then by 5.15 in the morning she was fully awake. At 6.30 in the morning, we gave her two ounces of water, and she watched television. And at 7.30, we had changed her diaper and then brought her downstairs for breakfast at 8.30 in the morning, she had breakfast. It was cereal with bananas. She really enjoyed it. After breakfast, she had her medication at 9 a.m., 125 milligrams of topiramate. She also had 10 milliliters of Milka Magnesia, and she had her albuterol treatment as well.

Sleep | n/a | Mira overall had a good night's sleep but woke up a couple of times and was fully awake by 5:15 in the morning.
Food/Drink | 6:30 am | Mira was given two ounces of water.
Entertainment | 6:30 am | Mira watched television.
Toileting | 7:30 am | Mira's diaper was changed.
Food/Drink | 8:30 am | Mira was brought downstairs for breakfast, where she had cereal with bananas and enjoyed it.
Medication | 9:00 am | Mira had her medications: 125 milligrams of topiramate, 10 milliliters of Milka Magnesia, and her albuterol treatment.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

6.30 a.m. 2 ounces of water given. 7.30 a.m. Albuterol treatment. 7.45 a.m. for breakfast. Toast with peanut butter and Nutella and milk. 8.30 a.m. 125 milligrams of tapiramate. 10 milliliters of milk of magnesia followed by 6 ounces of water.

Food/Drink | 6.30 a.m. | 2 ounces of water given.
Therapy | 7.30 a.m. | Albuterol treatment.
Food/Drink | 7.45 a.m. | Toast with peanut butter and Nutella and milk.
Medication | 8.30 a.m. | 125 milligrams of tapiramate.
Food/Drink | 8.30 a.m. | 10 milliliters of milk of magnesia followed by 6 ounces of water.

Friday, March 1st, 7 p.m. From 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Mira went to school. It was bingo night and she had a wonderful time playing bingo with her friends, teachers, therapists. It was a fun evening and she came home at 9 o'clock.

Entertainment | 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. | Went to school for bingo night.
Other | n/a | Had a wonderful time playing bingo with friends, teachers, and therapists.
Other | 9 p.m. | Came home after a fun evening.

Friday, March 1st, 6pm. Because Mira is going to be going to bingo at school, she had an early shower and then she had dinner at 6.15. She had ziti with chicken and for dessert she had berries.

Entertainment | n/a | Mira had an early shower in preparation for going to bingo at school.
Food/Drink | 6:15 PM | Mira had dinner, which consisted of ziti with chicken.
Food/Drink | n/a | For dessert, Mira had berries.

The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

Friday, March 1st, 4 p.m., Mira had a good day at school, according to the nurse. She ate some of her chicken nuggets and green beans, didn't like it, so the nurse gave her eight ounces of Ensure to supplement. She also had eight ounces of water throughout the day. Coming home, Mira had prunes as a snack. She had four ounces of Ensure and we gave her six ounces of water. We also gave her albuterol treatment.

Other | n/a | Mira had a good day at school according to the nurse.
Food/Drink | n/a | She ate some of her chicken nuggets and green beans but didn't like it.
Food/Drink | n/a | The nurse gave her eight ounces of Ensure to supplement.
Food/Drink | n/a | Mira had eight ounces of water throughout the day.
Food/Drink | n/a | Coming home, Mira had prunes as a snack.
Food/Drink | n/a | She had four ounces of Ensure.
Food/Drink | n/a | We gave her six ounces of water.
Medication | n/a | We also gave her albuterol treatment.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. Categorize each event Using the following categories: Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Sleep, Oxygen Level, Breathing Rate, Temperature, Glucose, Weight, Entertainment, Exercise, Food/Drink, Medication, Therapy, Toileting, Other. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

February 29th, 4 p.m., Mira came from school, had an albuterol treatment, had four ounces of Ensure, and at 5 o'clock she did her range-of-motion therapy. At 6 p.m., she had dinner, which consisted of lentils and cottage cheese. At 7 p.m., she finished her dinner and then went upstairs for a shower. At 7.30 p.m., she had her first medication of the evening, which was Clobazam, 15 milligram. At 8 p.m., she had her second medication, which is Topiramate, 125 milligram. And at 9 p.m., she had her third treatment, which is 15 milligrams of Baclofen. She had a really nice evening. She enjoyed watching television and then went to sleep at 9.30.

Other | 4 pm | Mira came from school.
Medication | 4 pm | Had an albuterol treatment.
Food/Drink | 4 pm | Had four ounces of Ensure.
Therapy | 5 pm | Did her range-of-motion therapy.
Food/Drink | 6 pm | Had dinner, which consisted of lentils and cottage cheese.
Other | 7 pm | Finished her dinner and then went upstairs for a shower.
Medication | 7:30 pm | Had her first medication of the evening, Clobazam, 15 milligram.
Medication | 8 pm | Had her second medication, Topiramate, 125 milligram.
Medication | 9 pm | Had her third treatment, 15 milligrams of Baclofen.
Entertainment | 9:30 pm | Enjoyed watching television.
Sleep | 9:30 pm | Then went to sleep.

You are going to take in a note from a caregiver about their patient describing one or more events that have occured. Split the note you recieve into a list of events. Categorize each event Using the following categories: Heart Rate, Blood Pressure, Sleep, Oxygen Level, Breathing Rate, Temperature, Glucose, Weight, Entertainment, Exercise, Food/Drink, Medication, Therapy, Toileting, Other. The format of the output should be: Category | Time (am/pm) | Associated Event. The output should be delimited using new lines. If the Time cannot be found use 'n/a'.

Friday, March 1st morning, Mira woke up at 6.30 in the morning. Overall, she had a good sleep, though did wake up a couple of times. She had two ounces of water. We changed her and then at 7.30 she came downstairs for breakfast. For breakfast she had cereal with bananas, which she ate very well and at 8 a.m. we gave her her first medication, which is 125 milligram topiramate, followed by 10 milliliters of milk of magnesia. She also had an albuterol treatment. At 8.45 in the morning, the school bus came and she went to school.

Sleep | 6.30 am | Mira woke up after a generally good sleep but woke up a couple of times.
Food/Drink | n/a | She had two ounces of water.
Toileting | n/a | Was changed.
Food/Drink | 7.30 am | Came downstairs for breakfast, having cereal with bananas.
Medication | 8 am | Given 125 milligram topiramate, followed by 10 milliliters of milk of magnesia and an albuterol treatment.
Other | 8.45 am | The school bus came, and she went to school.

Friday, March 1st at 7.30 p.m. Mira had her first medication Clobazam 15 milligrams. At 8 p.m. she had her second medication Topiramate 125 milligram and at 9 p.m. she had her third medication which is Baclofen 15 milligram and at 9.30 Mira went to sleep.

Medication | 7.30 pm | Mira had her first medication Clobazam 15 milligrams
Medication | 8 pm | Mira had her second medication Topiramate 125 milligrams
Medication | 9 pm | Mira had her third medication, Baclofen 15 milligrams
